event.title: established a post office on May 28, 1897

data.event: A community that had existed here had no official name until Dr. A. H. Collins, the town namesake, established a post office on May 28, 1897.
The name officially became Collinsville by June 1898 and it incorporated as a city in April 1899.

event.title: routed its line from Kansas to Owasso, Oklahoma about a mile west of Collinsville in 1899

data.event: The Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe routed its line from Kansas to Owasso, Oklahoma about a mile west of Collinsville in 1899, to avoid crossing an additional stream.

event.title: were moved on rollers to be nearer the track in 1899

data.event: The town's buildings were moved on rollers to be nearer the track in 1899 and 1900.
In 1918, the residents voted to be annexed by Tulsa County, in order to be nearer a county seat.
